summary: The Habitat Enhancement Now Act aims to improve migratory waterfowl populations through grant programs. It directs the Secretary of the Interior to establish competitive grant programs to: (1) fund the strategic placement, building, and maintenance of hen houses in the prairie pothole region; and (2) support the development of breeding habitat within California, including establishing nesting cover, creating brood ponds, and incentivizing landowners. Funding of $3,500,000 is allocated for each program annually from 2026-2030.
